subject: Re: Observations from a production use of JUnit4
msgSnippet: Yes. It might be nice to make it so that if the timeout was 1000ms it would say 1 second , but that s sugar. -- Ben ... express your
messageBody:
Yes. It might be nice to make it so that if the timeout was 1000ms it
would say '1 second', but that's sugar.

-- Ben

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Kent Beck" <kentb@...> wrote:
>
> Ben,
>
> Thank you for your detailed comments. Does the following test
express your
> expectations?
>
> static public class InfiniteLoopTest {
> @Test(timeout= 100) public void failure() {
> for(;;);
> }
> }
>
> @Test public void infiniteLoop() throws Exception {
> JUnitCore core= new JUnitCore();
> Result result= core.run(InfiniteLoopTest.class);
> assertEquals(1, result.getRunCount());
> assertEquals(1, result.getFailureCount());
> Throwable exception=
> result.getFailures().get(0).getException();
> System.out.println(exception.getMessage());
> assertTrue(exception.getMessage().contains("test timed out
> after 100 milliseconds"));
> }
>
> Sincerely yours,
>
> Kent Beck
> Three Rivers Institute
>
> > -----Original Message-----

> >
> > > > > @Test(expected=) traces
> > > > > -----------------------
> > > > >
> > > > > When you have an expected exception, and another one gets
> > thrown, the
> > > > > error trace doesn't contain the bad exception. You only get:
> > > > >
> > > > > java.lang.AssertionError: Unexpected exception,
> > > > > expected<java.util.NoSuchElementException> but
> > > > > was<java.lang.NullPointerException>
> > > > >
> > > > > Having the trace of the bad exception would help TAs
> > debug student
> > > code.
> > > > That's a good idea. We'll try to have that in the next release.
> > >
> > > Thanks. This also comes up with timeouts. It'd be really
> > cool to have
> > > a stacktrace from where the thread was hung.
> >
> > Actually, with timeouts there's another issue that came up from a
> > student today. The j.u.concurrent.TimeoutException doesn't have a
> > message that makes any sense. When that exception gets thrown it would
> > be nice to say "test execution timed out" or something.
> >
> > -- Ben
